member.name: M:NStandard.XString.NormalizeNewLine(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a new string which is normalized by the newline string of current environment.
If a string come from non-Unix platforms, then its NewLine is "\r\n".
If a string come from Unix platforms, then its NewLine is "\n".

member.name: M:NStandard.XString.GetPureLines(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Divides a string into multi-lines (ignore Empty or WhiteSpace). If the string is null, return string[0]. (Perhaps you should set `normalizeNewLine` to true to convert the NewLine which is defined in other system into the current system's.)

member.name: M:NStandard.XString.GetLines(System.String,System.Boolean)

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName
member.summary: Specifies the name of a cryptographic hash algorithm.
member.remarks:
Asymmetric Algorithms implemented using Microsoft's CNG (Cryptography Next Generation) API will interpret the underlying string value as a CNG algorithm identifier: * https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa375534(v=vs.85).aspx
As with CNG, the names are case-sensitive.
Asymmetric Algorithms implemented using other technologies: * Must recognize at least "MD5", "SHA1", "SHA256", "SHA384", and "SHA512". * Should recognize additional CNG IDs for any other hash algorithms that they also support.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.MD5
member.summary: Gets a representing "MD5"

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.SHA1
member.summary: Gets a representing "SHA1"

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.SHA256
member.summary: Gets a representing "SHA256"

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.SHA384
member.summary: Gets a representing "SHA384"

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.SHA512
member.summary: Gets a representing "SHA512"

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a representing a custom name.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.Name
member.summary: Gets the underlying string representation of the algorithm name.
member.remarks: May be null or empty to indicate that no hash algorithm is applicable.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.TryFromOid(System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName@)
member.summary: Tries to convert the specified OID to a hash algorithm name.
member.param: The OID of the hash algorithm.
When this method returns true, the hash algorithm. When this method returns false, contains default.
member.returns: true if the OID was successfully mapped to a hash algorithm; otherwise false.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName.FromOid(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified OID to a hash algorithm name.
member.param: The OID of the hash algorithm.
member.returns: The hash algorithm name identified by the OID.
member.exception: does not represent a known hash algorithm.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAEncryptionPaddingMode
member.summary: Specifies the padding mode to use with RSA encryption or decryption operations.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAEncryptionPaddingMode.Pkcs1
member.summary: PKCS #1 v1.5.
member.remarks: This mode corresponds to the RSAES-PKCS1-v1_5 encryption scheme described in the PKCS #1 RSA Encryption Standard. It is supported for compatibility with existing applications.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAEncryptionPaddingMode.Oaep
member.summary: Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding.
member.remarks: This mode corresponds to the RSAES-OEAP encryption scheme described in the PKCS #1 RSA Encryption Standard. It is recommended for new applications.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding
member.summary: Specifies the padding mode and parameters to use with RSA signature creation or verification operations.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding.Pkcs1
member.summary: mode.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding.Pss
member.summary: mode with the number of salt bytes equal to the size of the hash.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding.Mode
member.summary: Gets the padding mode to use.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePaddingMode
member.summary: Specifies the padding mode to use with RSA signature creation or verification operations.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePaddingMode.Pkcs1
member.summary: PKCS #1 v1.5.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the RSASSA-PKCS1-v1.5 signature scheme of the PKCS #1 RSA Encryption Standard. It is supported for compatibility with existing applications.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePaddingMode.Pss
member.summary: Probabilistic Signature Scheme.
member.remarks: This corresponds to the RSASSA-PKCS1-v1.5 signature scheme of the PKCS #1 RSA Encryption Standard. It is recommended for new applications.
